item.title: 潮水般涌现的中国茶叶品牌押宝赢得美国人的味蕾
item.description: 中国快速增长的饮料连锁店宁记柠檬茶的联合创始人阿曼达-王在推出专为迎合美国人口味而设计的 Bobobaba 之前，曾四次前往美国进行调研。【原文：Amanda Wang, co-founder of Chinese fast-growing beverage chain Ningji Lemon Tea, made four research trips to the U.S. before launching Bobobaba, designed to cater specifically to American tastes.】

item.title: 即将上任的英国石油公司（BP）首席执行官在澳大利亚伍德赛德公司（Woodside）留下了广阔的发展前景
item.description: 能源行业资深人士梅格-奥尼尔（Meg O'Neill）被英国石油公司（BP）选中，负责领导这家总部位于伦敦的老牌能源巨头的重组工作，当她执掌澳大利亚伍德赛德能源公司（Woodside Energy）时，立即引起了轰动，达成了一项交易，使其生产组合翻了一番。【原文：Energy industry veteran Meg O'Neill, tapped by BP to lead a shake-up at the venerable London-based major, made an immediate splash when she took the reins at Australia's Woodside Energy, clinching a deal that doubled its production portfolio.】

item.title: 更多超大型并购交易将出现，对规模的追逐推动并购交易接近破纪录的一年
item.description: 2025 年，交易商们如愿以偿：尽管动荡的春季威胁到了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普第二任期内并购活动复苏的希望，但这一年的并购活动几乎破了纪录。【原文：Dealmakers got what they wanted in 2025: an almost record-breaking year for mergers and acquisitions despite a turbulent spring that threatened hopes of a revival in activity during U.S. President Donald Trump’s second term.】

item.title: 美光在欧洲的股价因业绩预测大增而上涨 12
item.description: 美光科技公司（Micron Technology）在法兰克福上市的股票在周四欧洲早盘交易中飙升了近 12%，因为这家美国计算机内存芯片制造商做出了乐观的预测。【原文：Micron Technology's Frankfurt-listed shares soared almost 12% in early European trading on Thursday following an upbeat forecast from the U.S. computer memory chip maker.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯 STC 与 Humain 成立合资企业，推进数据中心建设
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯最大的电信运营商 STC 周四宣布与沙特人工智能公司 Humain 成立合资企业，共同开发和运营数据中心。【原文：Saudi Arabia's largest telecoms operator STC on Thursday announced a joint venture with the kingdom's artificial intelligence company Humain to develop and operate data centres.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，埃利奥特在收购战中向丰田工业的其他投资者示好
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引知情人士的话报道，埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）一直在与日本的资产管理公司和其他机构投资者接洽，以推动丰田集团改善其 300 亿美元的私有化丰田工业的出价。【原文：Elliott Investment Management has been approaching asset managers and other institutional investors in Japan to push Toyota group to improve its $30 billion bid to take Toyota Industries private, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》称，标准通用公司正在洽谈投资华纳兄弟探索网络事宜
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周四报道，纽约对冲基金 Standard General 创始人 Soo Kim 一直在洽谈收购或投资华纳兄弟 Discovery 电视网络的可能性。【原文：Soo Kim, founder of New York hedge fund Standard General, has been in talks over potentially buying or investing in the Warner Bros Discovery television networks, the Financial Times reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 即使欧盟妥协，欧洲汽车业的未来也可能是电动的
item.description: 分析师和专家表示，布鲁塞尔提议放弃2035年全面转向全电动驾驶的最后期限，这让欧洲传统汽车制造商有更多时间销售混合动力汽车，但从长远来看，电动汽车仍然是未来的趋势。【原文：Brussels' proposal to abandon a 2035 deadline for a total shift to fully electric driving allows Europe's legacy carmakers more time to sell hybrids, but for the longer term, EVs are still the future, analysts and experts said.】

item.title: 汉莎航空在经历颠簸后追赶欧洲竞争对手
item.description: 德国汉莎航空公司（Lufthansa）在首席执行官卡斯滕-施波尔（Carsten Spohr）的领导下又度过了喜忧参半的一年，在这一年结束之际，投资者仍对该公司持怀疑态度，因此汉莎航空发誓要在 2026 年开始实现其雄心勃勃的扭亏为盈计划。【原文：German airline group Lufthansa has vowed to start making its ambitious turnaround plan a reality in 2026 as investors remain sceptical at the end of another mixed year under Chief Executive Carsten Spohr.】

item.title: 英国石油公司（BP）在奥钦克劳斯突然离职后，首次由外部人士出任首席执行官梅格-奥尼尔（Meg O'Neill
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP）已任命澳大利亚伍德赛德能源公司（Woodside Energy）首席执行官梅格-奥尼尔（Meg O'Neill）为下一任首席执行官，这表明该公司在从雄心勃勃的可再生能源战略中撤退后，将再次推动提高回报率，并加倍努力发展石油和天然气业务。【原文：BP has named Meg O'Neill, chief executive of Australia's Woodside Energy , as its next CEO, signalling a renewed push to boost returns and double down on oil and gas after retreating from an ambitious renewables strategy.】

item.title: 中国在海南岛启动价值 1130 亿美元的自由贸易试验
item.description: 周四，中国将一个比利时大小、经济规模与一个中等国家相当的岛屿从大陆分离出来进行海关处理，这是中国加入一项重要的跨太平洋贸易协定并建立一个新的香港式商业中心的努力的一部分。【原文：China on Thursday split off a Belgium-sized island with an economy comparable to a mid-sized country from the mainland for customs processing, part of a bid to join a major trans-Pacific trade deal and establish a new Hong Kong-style commercial hub.】

item.title: 早间竞价：英国央行入选，其他机构继续坚持立场
item.description: Tom Westbrook 展望欧洲和全球市场的未来一天。【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Tom Westbrook.】

item.title: 让欧洲再次伟大 "交易的回归取决于德国的卷土重来
item.description: 对于自今年夏天以来一直被美国市场阴影笼罩的欧洲市场来说，投资者希望欧盟最大的经济体--德国的消费盛宴能在2026年推动市场的发展。但首先，他们需要看到能够实现这一目标的证据。【原文：For European markets overshadowed by the United States since the summer, investors are hoping a spending bonanza in Germany - the European Union's biggest economy - moves the dial in 2026. But first, they need to see evidence it will deliver.】

item.title: 中国万科开始与 20 亿元债券持有人举行第二次会议
item.description: 本周四，资金短缺的中国万科与20亿元（2.8399亿美元）债券的持有人举行了第二次会议，中国万科正努力延长与债券持有人和银行的债务偿还期，以避免违约。【原文：Cash-strapped China Vanke kicked off a second meeting with holders of a 2 billion yuan ($283.99 million) bond on Thursday, as it scrambles to extend its debt payments with bondholders and banks in an effort to avoid a default.】

item.title: 美国 11 月消费者物价可能创下 1 年半以来最大年度增幅
item.description: 经济学家们预测，在截至11月的一年中，美国消费者物价的涨幅可能是1年半以来最大的，这将凸显美国人面临的日益恶化的负担能力挑战，而这在一定程度上归咎于进口关税。【原文：U.S. consumer prices likely increased by the most in 1-1/2 years in the year to November, economists predicted, which would underscore the worsening affordability challenges confronting Americans that have been partly blamed on tariffs on imports.】

item.title: 波音与工会暂停前 Spirit AeroSystems 工程师的合同谈判
item.description: 劳工官员周三表示，与波音公司就机身供应商精神航空系统公司（Spirit AeroSystems）被该公司收购后约 1600 名白领工会成员的未来问题进行的合同谈判已暂停至 1 月 5 日。【原文：Labor officials said on Wednesday that contract talks with Boeing covering the future of roughly 1,600 white-collar union members at fuselage supplier Spirit AeroSystems after its acquisition by the planemaker had been paused until January 5.】

item.title: 尽管加征关税，中国消费巨头仍进军美国，因为国内市场停滞不前
item.description: 在丰厚利润承诺的诱惑下，一大波中国消费品牌正在深入进军美国零售业，以抵消国内消费疲软的影响。【原文：Lured by the promise of richer margins, a wave of Chinese consumer brands is making deeper inroads into American retail to offset sluggish spending at home.】

item.title: 特朗普称下任美联储主席将相信 "大幅 "降低利率
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周三表示，下一任美国联邦储备委员会（美联储）主席将是一个相信降息 "幅度很大 "的人。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday the next chairman of the U.S. Federal Reserve will be someone who believes in lower interest rates "by a lot."】

item.title: 在央行成为焦点之前，科技股受挫
item.description: 亚洲股市周四下跌，原因是科技行业因人工智能支出问题再次引发忧虑而受到打击，而投资者则在为将凸显全球政策分歧的央行会议做好准备。【原文：Asian shares fell on Thursday as the tech sector took a beating on renewed angst about AI spending, while investors braced for a wave of central bank meetings set to underscore policy divergence worldwide.】

item.title: 花旗集团晋升 Ryan Ellis 为澳大利亚和新西兰市场销售主管
item.description: 根据路透社周四看到的一份内部备忘录，花旗集团已任命 Ryan Ellis 为澳大利亚和新西兰市场销售主管，负责金融机构和企业业务。【原文：Citi has appointed Ryan Ellis as head of market sales for Australia and New Zealand, covering financial institutions and corporates, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 据 Insider 报道，亚马逊是撤出费米项目资金的潜在租户
item.description: 据《商业内幕》周三援引数据中心首席执行官托比-纽格鲍尔的话报道，亚马逊是撤出房地产投资信托公司费米（Fermi）大型数据中心项目资金的潜在租户。【原文：Amazon is the prospective tenant that withdrew funding from REIT Fermi's massive data-center project, Business Insider reported on Wednesday, citing the data center's CEO Toby Neugebauer.】

item.title: 英伟达首席执行官黄仁勋告诉《福克斯商业》："英伟达还没有给 OpenAI 一分钱
item.description: Nvidia 首席执行官黄仁勋（Jensen Huang）周三告诉《福克斯商业》（Fox Business），作为该公司向 ChatGPT 制造商投资 1000 亿美元计划的一部分，这家芯片制造商 "还没有给 OpenAI 一分钱"。【原文：Nvidia Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang told Fox Business on Wednesday the chipmaker has not given OpenAI "a single penny yet" as part of the company's plan to invest $100 billion in the ChatGPT maker.】

item.title: 央行决策迫在眉睫，美元兑英镑、日元保持涨势
item.description: 周四，随着市场为英国、欧洲和日本的央行决议做准备，美元兑主要货币保持涨势。【原文：The dollar held gains against its major counterparts on Thursday as markets positioned for central bank decisions in Britain, Europe and Japan.】

item.title: 苹果公司在日本向其他应用程序商店开放 iPhone
item.description: 苹果公司周三表示，为了遵守旨在促进日本智能手机市场竞争的新法律，该公司已向日本的替代应用程序商店开放 iPhone 和其他设备。【原文：Apple on Wednesday said it has opened iPhones and other devices to alternative app stores in Japan to comply with new laws aimed at stoking competition in that country's smartphone market.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Elliott 在 Lululemon 建立了超过 10 亿美元的股份，并计划引入新的首席执行官
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三报道，激进投资者埃利奥特管理公司（Elliott Management）已持有 Lululemon Athletica 超过 10 亿美元的股份，并正在推荐新的首席执行官人选，以扭转该公司的局面。【原文：Activist investor Elliott Management has built a more than $1 billion stake in Lululemon Athletica and is proposing a new CEO candidate to turn around the company, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 Optus 九月故障审查显示协议存在紧急漏洞
item.description: 澳大利亚第二大电信服务提供商 Optus 周四表示，对其 9 月份故障的独立审查发现，在流程、责任、升级和信息协议方面存在漏洞，亟需关注。【原文：Optus, Australia's second-largest telecoms services provider, said on Thursday that an independent review into its September outage found gaps in process, accountability, escalation, and information protocols that need urgent attention.】

item.title: 达美航空公司溢价战略的设计者将于二月退休
item.description: 达美航空公司（Delta Air Lines）周三表示，该公司总裁、高端战略设计者格伦-豪恩斯坦（Glen Hauenstein）将于二月退休。【原文：Delta Air Lines said on Wednesday that Glen Hauenstein, its president and the architect of its premium-focused strategy, will retire in February.】

item.title: 据 Information 报道，OpenAI 讨论以约 7500 亿美元的估值融资数百亿美元
item.description: 据《信息报》周三报道，OpenAI 已与一些投资者就以约 7500 亿美元的估值进行融资一事进行了初步谈判。【原文：OpenAI has held preliminary talks with some investors about raising at a valuation of around $750 billion, the Information reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 福特取消电动汽车电池交易后，韩国 LGES 股价下跌超过 7
item.description: LG Energy Solution 公司在一天前宣布福特汽车公司取消了一项电动汽车（EV）电池供应协议，该公司股价在周四早盘交易中最高下跌了 7.6%。【原文：Shares of LG Energy Solution dropped as much as 7.6% in morning trade on Thursday after the company announced a day earlier that Ford Motor had cancelled an electric vehicle (EV) battery supply deal.】

item.title: 独家报道亚马逊、沃尔玛股东推动公司报告特朗普移民政策的影响
item.description: 据路透社看到的文件显示，一个与工会结盟的投资团体周三致函亚马逊、沃尔玛和 Alphabet，询问美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的移民政策如何影响它们的财务和供应链。【原文：A union-aligned investment group sent letters to Amazon, Walmart and Alphabet on Wednesday, asking how U.S. President Donald Trump's immigration policies were impacting their finances and supply chains, according to the documents seen by Reuters.】
